text:
A couple of questions regarding using lunr+github pages: the documentation says
```If you are experimenting locally, just call lunr() then serve() and test that searching works as expected.
When you are ready to update your website you can [...] call publish(final=lunr),```
however the deploy documentation says
`
```If you use GitHub or GitLab with a deployment action on those platforms, you do not need to use publish, you can just push your changes and let the relevant action do the rest on the platform```
so my question is: should I modify the `deploy.yml`  file to generate the search index (I guess adding `lunr()` somewhere), or does the (latest) default deploy file already takes care of it?

elements.text: A couple of questions regarding using lunr+github pages: the documentation says

If you are experimenting locally, just call lunr() then serve() and test that searching works as expected.
When you are ready to update your website you can [...] call publish(final=lunr),
If you use GitHub or GitLab with a deployment action on those platforms, you do not need to use publish, you can just push your changes and let the relevant action do the rest on the platform
so my question is: should I modify the
file to generate the search index (I guess adding
somewhere), or does the (latest) default deploy file already takes care of it?

text:
yes that's exactly what you should do, and if you succeed you should ideally add your thoughts here: <https://github.com/tlienart/Franklin.jl/issues/754>

I don't think this is very hard to do but if you have issues with it let me know and I'll have a look at your repo!

text: thanks! I have just deployed the webpage <https://github.com/JuliaIntervals/JuliaIntervalsWebPage>, the pipeline was successful and github says "Your site is published at <https://juliaintervals.github.io/JuliaIntervalsWebPage/> ", however, when I click on the link it gives error 404. I suspect this is due to the name of the repository

text: I suspect maybe that's because I am trying to deploy the webpage as personal webpage while it should be a project webpage?

elements.text: I suspect maybe that's because I am trying to deploy the webpage as personal webpage while it should be a project webpage?

text: ok so 1 you should add `@def prepath = "JuliaIntervalsWebPage"`
and 2 you should check in the repo settings that it picks up the `gh-pages` branch for your page

text: what about the `@def website_url`, at the moment I have the url of the organziation there, does it affect the deployment?

text: the `website_url` is possibly a bit confusing, sorry, it's mostly used for RSS so you can ignore it :slightly_smiling_face: (setting it doesn't hurt but it's not considered in the deployment)
